name: pejoratively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that expresses disapproval, or suggests that something is not good or not important: used pejoratively The word "bureaucracy" is usually used pejoratively. I don't mean that pejoratively.
More examplesFewer examplesHousebuilders find projects threatened not just by what is pejoratively known as "nimbyism", but also by environmental concerns.When a public service is described as "a lottery", the term is usually meant pejoratively. He described him as a "typical modern player", making it clear that he was not using the phrase pejoratively.
